segments.text: Looking at the GMP documentation, there's a function called mpz_setbit that sets a specific bit. So the SetBit function here should call mpz_setbit on the value's mpz_t structure, passing the index. The line to add would be mpz_setbit(value.get_mpz_t(), index);. That should set the bit at the given index in the mpz_class object. Let me check the parameters again. The function is void SetBit(mpz_class& value, size_t index), so the parameters are correct. The GMP function takes the mpz_t pointer and the bit index. So yes, that's the right call.

Looking at the GMP documentation, there's a function called mpz_setbit that sets a specific bit. So the SetBit function here should call mpz_setbit on the value's mpz_t structure, passing the index. 

The line to add would be mpz_setbit(value.get_mpz_t(), index);. That should set the bit at the given index in the mpz_class object. Let me check the parameters again. The function is void SetBit(mpz_class& value, size_t index), so the parameters are correct. The GMP function takes the mpz_t pointer and the bit index. So yes, that's the right call.
